definitions.definition: the joint connecting the foot to the leg; the narrow part of the leg just above the ankle joint

examples.text: She suffered a serious **ankle injury** in training.
We found ourselves **ankle-deep** in water *(= the water came up to our ankles)*.
The injury required surgery on his right ankle.
He will wear an electronic **ankle bracelet**, which allows police to track him.
She has long legs and slender ankles.

wordOrigin: Old English ancleow, of Germanic origin; superseded in Middle English by forms from Old Norse; related to Dutch enkel and German Enkel, from an Indo-European root shared by the noun angle.
